results.title: Setting the scene: the Metropolis case
results.brief_description: A limited edition DVD presented exclusively to visitors of the ‘Setting the Scene’ exhibition at the Australian Centre of the Moving Image, Federation Square, Melbourne. featuring ‘The Metropolis case’ and special bonus material (‘The Restoration’ and ‘Photo Gallery’).

results.title: Setting the scene: landscape spaces (Chris Kennedy and Stephen Curtis)
results.brief_description: Interviews with Chris Kennedy and Stephen Curtis, Australian production designers on their work. Chris Kennedy talks about the two different approaches he took for two films, the building of a town in The Proposition and finding already existing locations for The Road. Stephen Curtis talks about his approach to production designing on his work on Bedevil and Night Cries. Prodcued by AFTRS and ACMI for ACMI’s Setting the Scene exhibition.

results.title: Setting the scene: designer interviews [rushes]
results.brief_description: A joint production between ACMI and AFTRS, the rushes of interviews with Australian production designers Victor Lam, Chris Kennedy, Roger Ford, Karen Murphy, Owen Paterson, Elizabeth Mary Moore and Stephen Curtis where they speak of their own process and challenges as designers as well as the production design in other films.

results.title: Setting the scene iPod tour: designer interviews
results.brief_description: A joint production with AFTRS, this is a series of four interviews with Australian production designers for the walking tour part of ACMI’s Setting the Scene exhibition. Roger Ford talks about Mon Oncle and The Terminal, Owen Paterson on Fritz Lang’s Metropolis, Chris Kennedy on Stanley Kubrick’s The Shining and Stephen Curtis on Peter Greenaway’s The Cook, the thief, his wife and her lover.
results.title_for_label: Setting the scene iPod tour: designer interviews

results.title: Setting the scene designer interviews: Stephen Curtis
results.brief_description: A co-production between AFTRS and ACMI for ACMI’s Setting the Scene exhibition. Stephen Curtis talks about his approach to production designing on his work on Bedevil and Night Cries. This was used as part of the Landscape Spaces section of the exhibition.

results.title: Setting the scene designer interviews: Roger Ford
results.brief_description: A co-production between AFTRS and ACMI for the Setting the Scene exhibition. Roger Ford talks about the role of a production designer on a production and his experience of creating computer-designed sets from Babe to The Chronicles of Narnia : Prince Caspian. Used as a part of the Virtual Spaces section of the exhibition.

results.title: Setting the scene designer interviews: Owen Paterson
results.brief_description: A co-production between AFTRS and ACMI for ACMI’s Setting the Scene exhibition. Owen Paterson discusses his work on Speed Racer and the Matrix and creating digital worlds. This was used in the Virtual Worlds section of the exhibition.
